intro: Lithocarpus subnucifer, commonly known as the broad-leafed stone oak, is a species of evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fagaceae, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its hard, thick-shelled fruits and leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical forests, often reaching heights of up to 30 meters. Lithocarpus subnucifer plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
